lines.text: Welcome to Wonderland, Alice.
I... am... eternal.
You shouldn't have buried me. I'm not dead.
How's this for a wet dream?
[about the roach motel]
You can check in, but you can't check out.
No pain, no gain.
[first title card]
"When deep sleep falleth on men, fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake." - Job IV, 13-14
Alice, come to daddy.
Elm Street's last brat. Farewell.
We beat you before!
And now you're all alone! Kristen, why don't you - uh - call on one of your little friends? Maybe they could help.
Never! I'm the last!
Why don't you... reach out... and cut someone?
[Kristen screams]

[knocks over cars on Freddy]
Take that, motherfucker!
We have matching luggage again. The bags under your eyes. Nightmares?
Yeah.
God, I hate dreaming.
Mmm. I love to dream. I just hate the ones about my Dad.
How do you handle your nightmares?
My Mom taught me when I was little. Did you ever hear of the dream master?
Sounds like a game show host to me.
No, it's a rhyme. Just have to dream about someplace fun. Remember, you're in control.
How do you know so much about dreams?
When, when it's all you have, you kinda become an expert.
Kristen! Freddy's back! Freddy's back! Freddy's back!
[Freddy stabs Kincaid in the stomach]
I'll see you in hell.
Tell 'em Freddy sent ya.
[Jams knives further and cackling]
One down, two to go.
[Jams knives further again]
Gasps and dies while, Freddy laughs maniacally]
Wanna suck face?
No!
Rest in hell.

[as nurse]
I wanna draw some blood!

[in response to Sheila's inhaler]
Hey, baby. You're sucking on the wrong nossil.
Hey, yo, needle dick! I bet you're the only male in this school suffering from penis envy.
How can you ride this health hazard? You know, it's no wonder that you have asthma.
No, you see, asthma is an inherited condition. Read a book now and then, you might know something.
You know, speaking of books, isn't trig your favorite?
[Shelia nods yes and realizes what Debbie's asking]
"Dynasty" again?
[Debbie smiles]
Deb, do us a favor and get a VCR.
[Disguised as the school nurse]
[Wakes Kristen with smelling salts]
Feeling better now?
What happened?
Don't worry, you had quite a nasty bump.
[turns around and starts to laugh darkly before turning around as himself]
I wanna draw some blood!
NO!
[is woken up by smelling salts]
No!
Feeling better now?
What happened?
You had quite a nasty bump.
[wakes up from anesthesia and sees a doctor with a burned face]
Krueger!
Well I ain't Dr. Seuss.
Sayonara, Rick-san!
I've been guarding my gate for a long time, bitch.
You flunk.
[after Kristen calls in Alice]
How sweet. Fresh meat.
You've got their powers. I've got their souls. Come on!
Mind over matter.
[Walks away]
Mind over matter? Sheila used to say that. God, every day she changes.
No. It's after every death.
Now I lay me down to sleep. The Master of Dreams my soul will keep. In the reflection OF MY MIND'S EYE...
Evil will see itself, and it shall die!
How do you know so much about dreams?
Well, when it's all you have you sort of become an expert.

[being served a pizza pie consisting of living human faces]
Mmm... the usual. My favorite. Mmm... Eeney, meeney, miney... MOE!
[stabs Rick's face with his glove]
Mmm... Rick, you little meatball. I love soul food. Bring me more.
[notices Debbie and laughs]
Your shift is over.
It's Avoid All Contact Day.
Joey! Kincaid! Help me!
Hey, Supergirl, it's dead. Give a bug a break.

[to Kristen]
Here comes your boyfriend. Can he give you a good night's sleep?

[to Kincaid and Joey]
We don't kiss and tell. How about you guys?
Swish. Killed a fish.

[mocking Debbie]
Oh, hi, handsome. Care for some buns?
Maybe Freddy can't get to the new kids unless there's someone to bring him to 'em.
God, I hate dreaming.
Mmm, I love to dream. I just hate the ones about my dad.
[after killing Kincaid]
One down. Two to go.
Something matter with the cuisine?
Well, Mom, I'll tell you, when two of your friends die in the same day, let me know what it does to your appetite.
Your just tired, don't think I haven't noticed you haven't been sleeping young lady, that has got to stop honey.

[suddenly gets up, feeling drowsy instantly]
What's wrong with me?
Adolescent anxiety. This will make it better.

[confused, looks at lemonade which is murky]
Oh, God! What did you do?
Oh, Kristen.
[grabs her Mom's purse and sleeping pills fall out]
Jesus! Sleeping pills!
Look, Kristen. I'm sorry. It's just...
Sorry? Sorry that you and your tennis pals torched this guy and now he's after me? In case you haven't been keeping score, it's his fucking banquet! And I'm the last course.
Kristen, we went over this in therapy!
No mother, you just murdered me. Take that to your goddamn therapy.
Kristen!
No.
[runs out of the dining room, sedated and falling, and up to her bedroom]

[waiting for Alice outside of the diner]
All the towns in America, and I gotta move to The Bermuda Triangle. That's great.
This ain't my dreamland. Kristen! If you're here, I'm gonna pound your ass!
You have no right to stop me. If you just knew what was going on.
I know very much what's going on with you and your friends.
Yeah, everybody thinks they know. But they don't.
Look at me, Alice. I lost Rick because I didn't watch him. I don't want to lose you. We're all we have.
I don't believe in you.
I believe in you.

[Rick comes in and sits next to Alice, who is watching a video with Rick and Kristen in it in happier days]
You made her so happy then.
Yeah, before all this Freddy shit.

[Turns to Rick]
You know, I saw it in my dream. Th-There was this horrible man...

[Interrupting Alice with a tone in his voice]
Oh, who, Freddy? Freddy? Look, I don't want to hear about Freddy, okay. I heard it all from Kristen and I don't want to hear anymore. So just stop it.
But I could smell the smoke, I can feel the fire. It wasn't a dream it was real!
I said stop it! She wasn't crazy and neither are you, so just stop it, please. God, why are you acting this way?
I don't know, Rick. Something happened in the dream and now... it's like she's a part of me.
What 17-year-old has fatal asthma?
If the food don't kill ya, the service will.
[laughs]
Listen, little sister, you got this freako talent to bring folds into your dream, but we don't need it anymore. Time to start living like regular people.
Yeah. Let it rest. Did it ever occur to you that if you keep going in, you might stir him up again? Look, we'll help you. We all have better things to dream about.

[slaps Joey a high five]
You got that right. Signed and sealed.

[shows the bite from Kincaid's dog]
Then what about this?
That don't mean dick. My dog is like me. Drag him into your crazy dream, and he gets wild.
I don't work out for hours everyday to let some nightstalker beat me!
You don't get it. He's not a nightstalker, and it'll take a lot more than bench presses to defeat him.
So, uh, why the haunted house?
It's not just a house. It's his home. He waiting in there for me to dream.
Hey, it's okay. We're with you.
I told you, you can't help me. This isn't a normal nightmare. I'm history.
She told us a story about Freddy. Fred Krueger. He's a town legend. He was a child killer freed on a technicality.
So?
So, a lot of parents got pissed of and, according to Kris, they hunted him down and roasted him like a Thanksgiving turkey.
[first lines]
Hello.
Do you live here?
Nobody lives here.
Where's Freddy?
Heh, heh. He's not home.
Fuckin' A.
Aw shit, Kristen! Not again!
What is happening to me?
Get away from him, you son of a bitch!
All the towns in america and I got to move The Bermuda Triangle.
Mm, there's Dan Jordan. Mm-hmm! We are talkin' one major-league hunk!
[Alice's daydreams]
You know, you are one major-league hunk.

[laughs]
Thanks, Alice.
[battling Alice in the dream church]
You think you've got what it takes? I've been guarding my gate for a long time, bitch.
[driving around while asleep, Alice spots Freddy standing in the road]
All right, I'm gonna punch his ticket in.
[jams on pedal harder, but Freddy disappears and car crashes]
